title: Rashbam on Exodus
text: ... He who wants to stand (or stick) to the literal translation of these texts, should be enlightened with this commentary. The people who came before me (i.e. other commentaries) did not understand anything. Moshe is responding to two things that Hashem said: 1. Go to Pharoah 2. Take the Jewish people out of Egypt based on the commandment of Pharoah. Moshe answers the first thing first, who am I to go to Pharoah even if i am just giving him a gift? Is it appropriate that I should go to the courtyard of the king as a foreigner like me? (Answering the second point) Even if i could go to visit Pharoah, I'm simpleminded and stupid towards other things, will Pharoah accept anything I say? Why would he listen to me? To send a huge nation free from his land? And you think he will accept that just based on what I say? That I will get his permission? Hashem answers the first thing first and says:
והכבד, seeing that the plague had been a severe one, Pharaoh’s natural obstinacy was not sufficient to cause him to renege on his promise, and G’d had to give his heart some assist.
The Book of the Covenant - It is written in Heaven: And Moshe will write, etc.
We will do and We will obey - We will do what is spoken, and also obey what is commanded later to then fulfill.
